do you guys idle  your car for a long time after cold start?
Usually just wait a while  then drive off slowly
Newer vehicles don't need to 'warm up' (idle after cold start). The new engine designs allow for immediate start and drive off.
i dont wait at all. i just drive off - slowly  till it heats up adequately
If I have time  wait for it to get upto temp (90Â°)  if not  I wait for the revs to go back down first then drive slowly until engine upto temp
Wait around 30 to 45 sec before moving off  let the engine oil circulate first
you are wasting fuel. and burns more carbons
i on already then rev to 5k rpm
even on the old e30  i dont do this. i drive off immediately
slowly of course in the beginning
a daily car is well lubricated even the next day cold start
Rather waste a bit of fuel than see a big bill in the future because I never take care of the engine
dont think you understand engine internals well
maybe blocked by what you think will damage engine because you need to warm up.
give the engine the cold treatment and it will get stronger and stronger
i NEVER said revv. i say move off SLOWLY
so dont force your words on me
i say the way i do it
whjen you move off slowly you build temperature
but you know how to build temp faster?

if you drive your car daily  even when you stop your engine say the day before  the cam shafts etc are still coated with engine oil the next day you do cold start. as you know wear occurs when engine is cold because oil flows back to the sump
if you revv is too early too fast  you risk destroying engine because the oil aint hot yet. and hence flows slows. this risks oil reaching the important parts
what you said is correct  but for older engines  or V8s V6s  i believe warming up the engine before moving off would be a precautionary measure
nothing wrong w wasting a dollar or 2 if tht helps u sleep at night
then i observed how germans do it. in cold winter freezing temperature  he starts his car and move off immediately  albeit slow.
one of them drives a Quattro. we might think they dont "take care" of engine. but soon  after engine oil heats up  they go balsting on autobahn
